page.title: 19Laughton Area-Unemployment
page.content: This page is contributed anonymously, by an unemployed man, who asked Mr. Gilmore, our class teacher, to put his thoughts into words. I'm a 34 year old craftsman, who has been unemployed for three years. I have been trying to obtain work in this area and as far afield as Sheffield, Rotherham and Doncaster during this time, but without success. I have also considered moving the family to another part of the country, but due to family commitments, this would mean the break up of my family. At the moment unemployment in Dinnington is in excess of 25% and worsening. If the colliery closes, which is likely, it will be over 30%. I desparately want to work, but the place is dying. I would have thought that the least a government could do for its citizens is provide work.
